intro: Calyptridium parryi subsp. nevadense, commonly known as the Nevada calyptridium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often colorful flowers. This subspecies is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
